summary: *Agaricus bisporus* is a type of mushroom that is commonly grown and eaten around the world. It is originally from grasslands in Eurasia and North America. You might know it as the "cultivated mushroom." It can be white or brown when it is young, and as it matures, it can turn chestnut or become a large portobello mushroom. People in over 70 countries grow and eat this mushroom. Be careful, though, as there are some wild mushrooms that look similar but are poisonous.
title: Agaricus bisporus
